author: jochembrouwer
content: In the mega eof spec, for DUPN/SWAPN/EXCHANGE it is noted that the stack needs to be validated. However, I am rather sure that this is done at deploy-time (it also seems to be in the EIP 663 itself), so I don't think the stack validation needs to be done?

author: _shemnon
content: For EOF all operations are guaranteed to have sufficient stack via the code and stack validation.  However if the operation code is shared with legacy there is no guarantee the stacks won't underflow or overflow when called in a legacy contract.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Right, but this stack validation is in the mega EOF spec, so we are in an EOF contract ü§î

author: jochembrouwer
content: Or should I read this as: this check should be done in the stack validation step and not at runtime? ü§î

author: _shemnon
content: Those are notes for the code and stack validation.

author: jochembrouwer
content: Aha, ok, this was not super clear to me
